Award.AwardTitle: NSF/CBMS Regional Conference in the Mathematical Sciences - Analysis of Stochastic Partial Differential Equations
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award will support an NSF/CMBS regional conference to be held at Michigan State University in the summer of 2013 on the topic of analysis of stochastic partial differential equations (SPDEs). The principal speaker will be Professor Davar Khoshnevisan from the University of Utah. The goals of the conference are to systematically study the fundamental notions, existing techniques and applications around SPDEs, to develop powerful new methods for investigating local behavior and intermittency of nonlinear SPDEs, and to reformulate and investigate problems which are significant for future development of SPDEs.


In addition to the 10 main lectures by Dr. Khoshnevisan, six lectures will be presented by other experts in these fields. This award will support approximately 25 participants at different stages of their careers, and a monograph will be produced.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The NSF/CBMS Conference ``Analysis of Stochastic Partial Differential Equations’’ was held at Michigan State University in East Lansing during August 19—23, 2013. The principal lecturer was Professor Davar Khoshnevisan from the University of Utah, who presented ten lectures.

The following are the titles of the ten lectures of Professor Davar Khoshnevisan:

      Lecture 1: Nonlinear noise excitation

      Lecture 2: Gaussian Random Fields

      Lecture 3: A Linear Heat Equation

      Lecture 4: Walsh-Dalang integrals

      Lecture 5: A Nonlinear Heat Equation

      Lecture 6: Intermezzo: Brownian Local Times

      Lecture 7: Intermittency

      Lecture 8: Intermittency Fronts

      Lecture 9: Intermittency Islands

      Lecture 10: Correlation length

The conference invited ten leading experts on Stochastic Partial Differential Equations (SPDEs) to give lectures on their recent research on topics related to the main lectures. There were also thirteen contributed talks given by recent Ph.D.s and junior faculty.  

There were more than 70 registered participants, among them, 19 were graduate students and 17 were females. Most of the participants were from the U.S., 13 of them came from abroad (Canada, China, Hong Kong, Israel, Italy, South Africa, Spain, Switzerland, Taiwan and U.K.)  Though most participants had had exposure to SPDEs, quite a few participants (mostly graduate students) used the opportunity to study this interesting topic. The main lectures given by Professor Davar Khoshnevisan covered the foundation, main tools as well as state of the art research on SPDEs. The lectures presented by the invited speakers further contributed to the current research on SPDEs. Thus the CBMS conference provided an excellent learning opportunity for all the participants. The conference schedule was flexible and participants had time to hold discussions among themselves. Some of them started collaborative research during the conference. 

The lectures presented by Professor Davar Khoshnevisan and invited speakers were very well received. In the evaluation forms the PIs received, the principal lecturer was described as ``well-prepared’’ and his lectures were ``excellent’’, ``very well done’’ and the invited talks were ``excellent'' and ``very interesting''.  Some participants listed ``the competence of the main speaker, the quality of talks, the quality of participants, opportunities for interactions/discussions with researchers from related areas, the excellent organization’’ as the most valuable about this CBMS conference. The PIs have no doubt that the intellectual and educational impact of this CBMS conference were very significant. 

From the NSF grant for the conference, the PIs provided financial support for lodging and travel to Professor Davar Khoshnevisan, 7 invited speakers (among them two were females) and 35 other participants including 7 females and 11 graduate students.

 During 8/19—8/23, 2013, the conference provided breakfast, coffee and lunch to all participants. On Thursday afternoon, 8/22, the PIs organized a hiking and picnic for all the participants.  Based on the feedback, the participants were very satisfied with the organization of this conference.
